bibl.title: Circular from Gaboon, December 8, 1866
Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

div1.p: The administration in communicating to Messrs the merchants and retail dealers the enclosed decree has thought proper to take advantage of the opportunity to inform them that according to the declaration which they have to make concerning their trade within the delay prescribed by the article 2 of the decree of November 16th last, that is to say, until the 20 of December next, it will proceed commencing with the latter date to prepare the list of names indicating the description of business of each and the assesment of the corresponding contribution.

Gaboon December 8th 1866
The
Director of the Interior
(Signed) Goby

Approved
By the R. Admiral Commander on Chief
absent and by order
The Commandant Particular
(Signed) Aube
